FedRAMP Validation Logic

Last updated June 2 2022 16:51 -05:00.

Information from fedramp_values.xml and FedRAMP_extensions.xml is presented.

Business Rules

References to a "checklist" are to the Agency Authorization Review Report document.

References to a "guide" are to one of the guides found here.

List of business rules and guide references
RuleReferences
A FedRAMP OSCAL XML SSP submission must be well-formed.
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP Content §1.6
href: https://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#sec-well-formed
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP OSCAL XML SSP submission must be syntactically valid relative to the OSCAL XML Schema.
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP Content §1.6.1
href: https://github.com/usnistgov/OSCAL/blob/main/xml/schema/oscal_ssp_schema.xsd
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP SSP submission must provide an Executive Summary.
checklist-reference: Section A
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP SSP submission must provide an Initial Authorization Package Checklist.
checklist-reference: Section B Check 1.0
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP SSP submission must provide an Authority to Operate (ATO).
checklist-reference: Section B Check 2.0
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a Control Implementation Summary (CIS) Workbook.
attachment: §15 Attachment 8
checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.8
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §6
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP SSP submission must include a Security Assessment Plan (SAP).
checklist-reference: Section B Check 4.0
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP SSP submission must include a Security Assessment Report (SAR).
checklist-reference: Section B Check 5.0
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP SSP submission must include Plans of Action and Milestones (POA&Ms).
checklist-reference: Section B Check 6.0
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP SSP submission must include a Continuous Monitoring Plan (ConMon Plan).
checklist-reference: Section B Check 7.0
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP SSP must use the correct FedRAMP SSP Template.
checklist-reference: Section C Check 1a
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
A FedRAMP SSP must use the correct FedRAMP Deployment Model.
checklist-reference: Section C Check 1b
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, customer responsibilities are clearly identified in the CIS-CRM Tab, as well as the SSP Controls (by checkbox selected and in the implementation description). The CIS-CRM and SSP controls are consistent for customer responsibilities.
checklist-reference: Section C Check 4a
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, the Initial Authorizing Agency concurs with the CRM (adequacy and clarity of customer responsibilities).
checklist-reference: Section C Check 4b
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, the Roles Table (User Roles and Privileges) sufficiently describes the range of user roles, responsibilities, and access privileges.
checklist-reference: Section C Check 5
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, the authorization boundary is explicitly identified in the network diagram.
checklist-reference: Section C Check 8a
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, does the CSO provide components to run on the client side?
checklist-reference: Section C Check 8b
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, there is a data flow diagram that clearly illustrates the flow and protection of data going in and out of the service boundary and that includes all traffic flows for both internal and external users.
checklist-reference: Section C Check 9
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, does the CSP use any third-party or external cloud services that lack FedRAMP Authorization?
checklist-reference: Section C Check 10
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, if this is a SaaS or a PaaS, is it "leveraging" another IaaS with a FedRAMP Authorization?
checklist-reference: Section C Check 11a
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, all interconnections are correctly identified and documented in the SSP.
checklist-reference: Section C Check 12
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, the CSO is compliant with DNSSEC. (Controls SC-20 and SC-21 apply).
checklist-reference: Section C Check 15
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
Within a FedRAMP SSP, the CSO adequately employs Domain-based Message Authentication, Reporting & Conformance (DMARC) requirements according to DHS BOD 18-01.
checklist-reference: Section C Check 16
Lacks Schematron assertion(s)
The validation technical components are present.
Has Schematron assertion: no-registry-values
[Section C Check 1.a] A FedRAMP SSP must define its sensitivity level.
checklist-reference: Section C Check 1.a
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.2
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2.2
Has Schematron assertion: no-security-sensitivity-level
Related Schematron assertions
no-security-sensitivity-level
invalid-security-sensitivity-level
security-sensitivity-level-matches-security-impact-level
has-security-objective-confidentiality
has-security-objective-integrity
has-security-objective-availability
has-allowed-security-objective-value
has-fedramp-authorization-type
[Section C Check 1.a] A FedRAMP SSP must have an allowed sensitivity level.
checklist-reference: Section C Check 1.a
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.2
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2.2
Has Schematron assertion: invalid-security-sensitivity-level
Related Schematron assertions
no-security-sensitivity-level
invalid-security-sensitivity-level
security-sensitivity-level-matches-security-impact-level
has-security-objective-confidentiality
has-security-objective-integrity
has-security-objective-availability
has-allowed-security-objective-value
has-fedramp-authorization-type
A FedRAMP SSP must implement a statement for each of the following lettered response points for required controls: .
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5
Has Schematron assertion: implemented-response-points
Related Schematron assertions
implemented-response-points
each-required-control-report

missing-response-components
extraneous-response-description
extraneous-response-remarks
invalid-component-match
missing-component-description
incomplete-response-description
incomplete-response-remarks
implemented-requirement-has-required-response-points

guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5

template-reference: System Security Plan Template §9.3

Every declared embedded attachment has a filename attribute.
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP Content §4.10
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15

has-pta-question-1
has-pta-question-2
has-pta-question-3
has-pta-question-4
has-all-pta-questions
has-correct-pta-question-cardinality
has-sorn
has-pia
[Section B Check 3.4] A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #4.
checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.4
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §6.4
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15 Attachment 4

[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP SSP must have a Digital Identity Determination property.
checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.5
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2.3
Has Schematron assertion: has-security-eauth-level

checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.5
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2.3

Related Schematron assertions

has-allowed-authenticator-assurance-level
has-allowed-federation-assurance-level
[Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7] A FedRAMP SSP may have a Digital Identity Determination authenticator assurance level property.
checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.3, Section C Check 7
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.5
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2.3
Has Schematron assertion: has-authenticator-assurance-level

has-allowed-federation-assurance-level

template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2.3

inventory-item-has-one-function
An inventory item must have an asset-type.
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §6.5
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15 Attachment 13
Has Schematron assertion: inventory-item-has-asset-type
Related Schematron assertions

The role for a responsible party must exist.
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.6-§4.11
Has Schematron assertion: responsible-party-has-role
Related Schematron assertions
role-has-title
role-has-responsible-party
responsible-party-has-role
responsible-party-is-person
party-has-responsibility
party-has-one-responsibility
One or more parties must be identified for a responsibility.
Has Schematron assertion: responsible-party-has-party-uuid
Every responsible party must be defined.
Has Schematron assertion: responsible-party-has-definition
For some roles responsible parties must be persons.
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.6-§4.11
Has Schematron assertion: responsible-party-is-person
Related Schematron assertions

invalid-implementation-status
implemented-requirement-has-implementation-status
implemented-requirement-has-planned-completion-date
partial-implemented-requirement-has-plan
implemented-requirement-has-allowed-composite-implementation-status
implemented-requirement-has-allowed-implementation-status
implemented-requirement-has-implementation-status-remarks
planned-completion-date-is-valid
planned-completion-date-is-not-past
A FedRAMP SSP must specify a cloud service model.

template-reference: System Security Plan Template §8.1

interconnection-has-isa-poc-remote
interconnection-has-isa-authorizing-official-local
interconnection-has-isa-authorizing-official-remote
interconnection-has-distinct-isa-local
interconnection-has-distinct-isa-remote
interconnection-cites-interconnection-agreement
interconnection-cites-interconnection-agreement-href
interconnection-cites-attached-interconnection-agreement
interconnection-protocol-has-name
interconnection-protocol-has-port-range
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-transport
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-start
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-end
A system interconnection must cite an intra-document defined interconnection agreement.
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
Has Schematron assertion: interconnection-cites-interconnection-agreement-href
Related Schematron assertions
interconnection-has-allowed-interconnection-direction-value

interconnection-has-title
interconnection-has-description
interconnection-has-direction
interconnection-has-information
interconnection-has-protocol
interconnection-has-service-processor

interconnection-has-interconnection-security
interconnection-has-circuit
interconnection-has-isa-poc-local
interconnection-has-isa-poc-remote
interconnection-has-isa-authorizing-official-local
interconnection-has-isa-authorizing-official-remote
interconnection-has-distinct-isa-local
interconnection-has-distinct-isa-remote
interconnection-cites-interconnection-agreement
interconnection-cites-interconnection-agreement-href
interconnection-cites-attached-interconnection-agreement
interconnection-protocol-has-name
interconnection-protocol-has-port-range
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-transport
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-start
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-end
A system interconnection must cite an intra-document attached interconnection agreement and that agreement must be present in the SSP.
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
Has Schematron assertion: interconnection-cites-attached-interconnection-agreement

A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a starting port number.
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
Has Schematron assertion: interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-start
Related Schematron assertions
interconnection-has-allowed-interconnection-direction-value

interconnection-has-description

interconnection-has-isa-authorizing-official-remote

interconnection-has-distinct-isa-remote

interconnection-cites-interconnection-agreement-href
interconnection-cites-attached-interconnection-agreement
interconnection-protocol-has-name
interconnection-protocol-has-port-range
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-transport
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-start
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-end
A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state an ending port number. The start and end port number can be the same if there is one port number.
guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
Has Schematron assertion: interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-end
Related Schematron assertions
interconnection-has-allowed-interconnection-direction-value

interconnection-protocol-has-port-range
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-transport
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-start
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-end

Schematron Assertion Messages

The following table shows affirmative (👍) messages and negative (👎), or diagnostic, messages for each Schematron assertion.

Messages are predominantly simple English prose statements. Some messages employ substitutions which are replaced when validation occurs and are highlighted thus: <sch:value-of select="current()/@media-type"/>.

Assertion IDSchematron Messages
parameter-use-remote-resources
👍 parameter use-remote-resources is <sch:value-of select="$param-use-remote-resources"/>.
👎
environment-variable-use-remote-resources
👍 environment-variable use_remote_resources is <sch:value-of select=" if (environment-variable('use_remote_resources') ne '') then environment-variable('use_remote_resources') else 'not defined'"/>.
👎
variable-use-remote-resources
👍 variable use-remote-resources is <sch:value-of select="$use-remote-resources"/>.
👎
parameter-use-debug-mode
👍 parameter use-debug-mode is <sch:value-of select="$param-use-debug-mode"/>.
👎
environment-variable-use-debug-mode
👍 environment-variable use_debug_mode is <sch:value-of select=" if (environment-variable('use_debug_mode') ne '') then environment-variable('use_debug_mode') else 'not defined'"/>.
👎
variable-use-debug-mode
👍 variable use-debug-mode is <sch:value-of select="$use-debug-mode"/>.
👎
no-registry-values
👍 The validation technical components are present.
👎 The validation technical components at the path '<sch:value-of select="$registry-base-path"/>' are not present, this configuration is invalid.
no-security-sensitivity-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define its sensitivity level.
👎 No sensitivity level was found. Allowed values are: <sch:value-of select="$corrections"/>. As a result, no more validation processing can occur.
invalid-security-sensitivity-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have an allowed sensitivity level.
👎 <sch:value-of select="./name()"/> is an invalid value of '<sch:value-of select="lv:sensitivity-level(/)"/>', not an allowed value of <sch:value-of select="$corrections"/>. No more validation processing can occur.
implemented-response-points
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must implement a statement for each of the following lettered response points for required controls: <sch:value-of select="$implemented/@statement-id"/>.
👎
no-description-text-in-component
👍 A component must have a description with content.
👎 Component _<xsl:value-of select="oscal:title"/>_ is missing a description.
each-required-control-report
👍 Sensitivity-level is <sch:value-of select="$sensitivity-level"/>, the following <sch:value-of select="count($required-controls)"/><sch:value-of select=" if (count($required-controls) = 1) then ' control' else ' controls'"/> are required: <sch:value-of select="$required-controls/@id"/>.
👎
incomplete-core-implemented-requirements
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must implement the most important controls.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP must implement the most important <sch:value-of select="count($core-missing)"/> core <sch:value-of select=" if (count($core-missing) = 1) then ' control' else ' controls'"/>: <sch:value-of select="$core-missing/@id"/>.
incomplete-all-implemented-requirements
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must implement all required controls.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP must implement <sch:value-of select="count($all-missing)"/><sch:value-of select=" if (count($all-missing) = 1) then ' control' else ' controls'"/> overall: <sch:value-of select="$all-missing/@id"/>.
extraneous-implemented-requirements
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must not include implemented controls beyond what is required for the applied baseline.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP must implement <sch:value-of select="count($extraneous)"/> extraneous <sch:value-of select=" if (count($extraneous) = 1) then ' control' else ' controls'"/> not needed given the selected profile: <sch:value-of select="$extraneous/@control-id"/>.
control-implemented-requirements-stats
👍 <sch:value-of select="$results => lv:report() => normalize-space()"/>.
👎
leveraged-PE-controls-implemented-requirement
👍 This PE Control has a leveraged authorization - <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/>.
👎 This PE Control does not have a matching leveraged authorization - <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/>.
invalid-implementation-status
👍 Implementation status is correct.
👎 Invalid implementation status '<sch:value-of select="$status"/>' for <sch:value-of select="./@control-id"/>, must be <sch:value-of select="$corrections"/>.
DNSSEC-described
👍 Implemented Requirement <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/> exists.
👎 The implemented requirement does not contain the strings 'DNSSEC' or 'DNS Security Extensions'.
missing-response-components
👍 Response statements have one or more components.
👎 Response statements for <sch:value-of select="./@statement-id"/> must have at least <sch:value-of select="$required-components-count"/><sch:value-of select=" if (count($components-count) = 1) then ' component' else ' components'"/> with a description. There are <sch:value-of select="$components-count"/>.
extraneous-response-description
👍 Response statement has a description not within a component.
👎 Response statement <sch:value-of select="../@statement-id"/> may not have a description not within a component. This is invalid.
extraneous-response-remarks
👍 Response statement does not have remarks not within a component.
👎 Response statement <sch:value-of select="../@statement-id"/> has remarks not within a component. That was previously allowed, but not recommended. It will soon be syntactically invalid and deprecated.
invalid-component-match
👍 Response statement cites a component in the system implementation inventory.
👎 Response statement <sch:value-of select="../@statement-id"/> with component reference UUID ' <sch:value-of select="$component-ref"/>' is not in the system implementation inventory, and cannot be used to define a control.
missing-component-description
👍 Response statement has a component which has a required description.
👎 Response statement <sch:value-of select="../@statement-id"/> has a component, but that component is missing a required description node.
incomplete-response-description
👍 Response statement component description has adequate length.
👎 Response statement component description for <sch:value-of select="../../@statement-id"/> is too short with <sch:value-of select="$description-length"/> characters. It must be <sch:value-of select="$required-length"/> characters long.
incomplete-response-remarks
👍 Response statement component remarks have adequate length.
👎 Response statement component remarks for <sch:value-of select="../../@statement-id"/> is too short with <sch:value-of select="$remarks-length"/> characters. It must be <sch:value-of select="$required-length"/> characters long.
incorrect-role-association
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with no extraneous roles.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with <sch:value-of select="count($extraneous-roles)"/><sch:value-of select=" if (count($extraneous-roles) = 1) then ' role' else ' roles'"/> not defined in the role: <sch:value-of select="$extraneous-roles/@role-id"/>.
incorrect-party-association
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with no extraneous parties.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with <sch:value-of select="count($extraneous-parties)"/><sch:value-of select=" if (count($extraneous-parties) = 1) then ' party' else ' parties'"/> is not a defined party: <sch:value-of select="$extraneous-parties/oscal:party-uuid"/>.
resource-uuid-required
👍 Every supporting artifact found in a citation has a unique identifier.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP has a back-matter resource which lacks a UUID.
resource-base64-available-filename
👍 Every declared embedded attachment has a filename attribute.
👎 This base64 lacks a filename attribute.
resource-base64-available-media-type
👍 Every declared embedded attachment has a media type.
👎 This base64 lacks a media-type attribute.
resource-has-uuid
👍 Every supporting artifact found in a citation must have a unique identifier.
👎 This resource lacks a uuid attribute.
resource-has-title
👍 Every supporting artifact found in a citation should have a title.
👎 This resource lacks a title.
resource-has-rlink
👍 Every supporting artifact found in a citation must have a rlink element.
👎 This resource lacks a rlink element.
resource-is-referenced
👍 Every supporting artifact found in a citation should be referenced from within the document.
👎 This resource lacks a reference within the document.
attachment-type-is-valid
👍 A supporting artifact found in a citation should have an allowed attachment type.
👎 Found unknown attachment type «<sch:value-of select="@value"/>» in <sch:value-of select=" if (parent::oscal:resource/oscal:title) then concat('"', parent::oscal:resource/oscal:title, '"') else 'untitled'"/> resource.
rlink-has-href
👍 Every supporting artifact found in a citation rlink must have a reference.
👎 This rlink lacks an href attribute.
rlink-href-is-available
👍 Every supporting artifact found in a citation rlink must have a reachable reference.
👎 This supporting artifact found in a citation rlink has an unreachable reference.
has-allowed-media-type
👍 A media-type attribute must have an allowed value.
👎 This <sch:value-of select="name(parent::node())"/> has a media-type="<sch:value-of select="current()/@media-type"/>" which is not in the list of allowed media types. Allowed media types are <sch:value-of select="string-join($media-types, ' ∨ ')"/>.
resource-has-base64
👍 A supporting artifact found in a citation should have an embedded attachment element.
👎 This resource lacks a base64 element.
resource-has-base64-cardinality
👍 A supporting artifact found in a citation must have only one embedded attachment element.
👎 This resource must not have more than one base64 element.
base64-has-filename
👍 Every embedded attachment element must have a filename attribute.
👎 This base64 must have a filename attribute.
base64-has-media-type
👍 Every embedded attachment element must have a media type.
👎 This base64 element lacks a media-type attribute.
base64-has-content
👍 Every embedded attachment element must have content.
👎 This base64 element lacks content.
has-fedramp-acronyms
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have the FedRAMP Master Acronym and Glossary attached.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks the FedRAMP Master Acronym and Glossary.
has-fedramp-citations
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have the FedRAMP Applicable Laws and Regulations attached.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks the FedRAMP Applicable Laws and Regulations.
has-fedramp-logo
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have the FedRAMP Logo attached.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks the FedRAMP Logo.
has-user-guide
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have a User Guide attached.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a User Guide.
has-rules-of-behavior
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have Rules of Behavior.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Rules of Behavior.
has-information-system-contingency-plan
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have a Contingency Plan attached.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Contingency Plan.
has-configuration-management-plan
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have a Configuration Management Plan attached.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Configuration Management Plan.
has-incident-response-plan
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have an Incident Response Plan attached.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks an Incident Response Plan.
has-separation-of-duties-matrix
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have a Separation of Duties Matrix attached.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Separation of Duties Matrix.
has-policy-link
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a policy document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.
👎 implemented-requirement <sch:value-of select="@control-id"/> lacks policy reference(s) via legacy or component approach.
has-policy-attachment-resource
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a policy document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.
👎 implemented-requirement <sch:value-of select="@control-id"/> lacks policy attachment resource(s) <sch:value-of select="string-join($policy-hrefs, ', ')"/>.
has-procedure-link
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a procedure document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.
👎 implemented-requirement <sch:value-of select="@control-id"/> lacks procedure reference(s) via legacy or component approach.
has-procedure-attachment-resource
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a procedure document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.
👎 implemented-requirement <sch:value-of select="@control-id"/> lacks procedure attachment resource(s) <sch:value-of select="string-join($procedure-hrefs, ', ')"/>.
has-unique-policy-and-procedure
👍 Policy and procedure documents must have unique per-control-family associations.
👎 A policy or procedure reference was incorrectly re-used.
has-privacy-poc-role
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a Privacy Point of Contact role.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Privacy Point of Contact role.
has-responsible-party-privacy-poc-role
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must declare a Privacy Point of Contact responsible party role reference.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Privacy Point of Contact responsible party role reference.
has-responsible-privacy-poc-party-uuid
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must declare a Privacy Point of Contact responsible party role reference identifying the party by unique identifier.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Privacy Point of Contact responsible party role reference identifying the party by UUID.
has-privacy-poc
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define a Privacy Point of Contact.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Privacy Point of Contact.
has-correct-yes-or-no-answer
👍 A Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question must have an allowed answer.
👎 This property has an incorrect value: should be "yes" or "no".
has-privacy-sensitive-designation
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have a privacy-sensitive designation.
👎 The privacy-sensitive designation is missing.
has-pta-question-1
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #1.
👎 The Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #1 is missing.
has-pta-question-2
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #2.
👎 The Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #2 is missing.
has-pta-question-3
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #3.
👎 The Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #3 is missing.
has-pta-question-4
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #4.
👎 The Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question #4 is missing.
has-all-pta-questions
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have all four PTA questions.
👎 One or more of the four PTA questions is missing.
has-correct-pta-question-cardinality
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have no duplicate PTA questions.
👎 One or more of the four PTA questions is a duplicate.
has-sorn
👍 A FedRAMP SSP may have a SORN ID.
👎 The SORN ID is missing.
has-pia
👍 This FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a Privacy Impact Analysis.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Privacy Impact Analysis.
has-CMVP-validation
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate one or more FIPS 140 validated modules.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP does not declare one or more FIPS 140 validated modules.
has-CMVP-validation-reference
👍 Every FIPS 140 validation citation must have a validation reference.
👎 This validation component or inventory-item lacks a validation-reference property.
has-CMVP-validation-details
👍 Every FIPS 140 validation citation must have validation details.
👎 This validation component or inventory-item lacks a validation-details link.
has-credible-CMVP-validation-reference
👍 A validation reference must provide a NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) certificate number.
👎 This validation-reference property does not resemble a CMVP certificate number.
has-consonant-CMVP-validation-reference
👍 A validation reference must be in accord with its sibling validation details.
👎 This validation-reference property does not match its sibling validation-details href.
has-credible-CMVP-validation-details
👍 A validation details must refer to a NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) certificate detail page.
👎 This validation-details link href attribute does not resemble a CMVP certificate URL.
has-accessible-CMVP-validation-details
👍 The NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) certificate detail page is available.
👎 This validation-details link references an inaccessible NIST CMVP certificate.
has-consonant-CMVP-validation-details
👍 A validation details link must be in accord with its sibling validation reference.
👎 This validation-details link href attribute does not match its sibling validation-reference value.
has-security-sensitivity-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify a FIPS 199 categorization.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a FIPS 199 categorization.
has-security-impact-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify a security impact level.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a security impact level.
has-allowed-security-sensitivity-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed security sensitivity level.
👎 Invalid security-sensitivity-level "<sch:value-of select="."/>". It must have one of the following <sch:value-of select="count($security-sensitivity-levels)"/> values: <sch:value-of select="string-join($security-sensitivity-levels, ' ∨ ')"/>.
security-sensitivity-level-matches-security-impact-level
👍 <xsl:value-of select="$securityLevelStr"/> -- A FedRAMP SSP security sensitivity level must match the highest level within the security impact levels.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP security sensitivity level does not match the security impact level.
has-security-objective-confidentiality
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify a confidentiality security objective.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a confidentiality security objective.
has-security-objective-integrity
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify an integrity security objective.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks an integrity security objective.
has-security-objective-availability
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify an availability security objective.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks an availability security objective.
has-allowed-security-objective-value
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed security objective value.
👎 Invalid "<sch:value-of select="name()"/>" <sch:value-of select="."/>". It must have one of the following <sch:value-of select="count($security-objective-levels)"/> values: <sch:value-of select="string-join($security-objective-levels, ' ∨ ')"/>.
cia-impact-matches-security-objective
👍 An SSP security objective value must be the same as highest available value of the same information type impact element.
👎 The FedRAMP SSP security objective <xsl:value-of select="substring-after(substring-after(local-name(), '-'), '-')"/> does not match the <xsl:value-of select="substring-after(substring-after(local-name(), '-'), '-')"/> impact value.
system-information-has-information-type
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define at least one information type.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP lacks at least one information-type.
information-type-has-title
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type must have a title.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type lacks a title.
information-type-has-description
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type must have a description.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type lacks a description.
information-type-has-categorization
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type must have at least one categorization.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type lacks at least one categorization.
information-type-has-confidentiality-impact
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type must have a confidentiality impact.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type lacks a confidentiality-impact.
information-type-has-integrity-impact
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type must have an integrity impact.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type lacks a integrity-impact.
information-type-has-availability-impact
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type must have an availability impact.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type lacks a availability-impact.
categorization-has-system-attribute
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type categorization must have a system attribute.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type categorization lacks a system attribute.
categorization-has-correct-system-attribute
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type categorization must have a correct system attribute.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type categorization lacks a correct system attribute. The correct value is "https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-60v2r1".
categorization-has-information-type-id
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type categorization must have at least one information type identifier.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type categorization lacks at least one information-type-id.
has-allowed-information-type-id
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type identifier must be chosen from those found in NIST SP 800-60v2r1.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type-id lacks a SP 800-60v2r1 identifier.
cia-impact-has-base
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact must specify the base impact.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type confidentiality-, integrity-, or availability-impact lacks a base element.
cia-impact-has-selected
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact must specify the selected impact.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type confidentiality-, integrity-, or availability-impact lacks a selected element.
cia-impact-has-adjustment-justification
👍 When SP 800-60 base and selected impacts levels differ for a given information type, the SSP must include a justification for the difference.
👎 These SP 800-60 base and selected impact levels differ, but no justification for the difference is supplied.
cia-impact-has-approved-fips-categorization
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must indicate for its information system the appropriate categorization for the respective confidentiality, integrity, impact levels of its information types (per FIPS-199).
👎 This FedRAMP SSP information type's confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact level, either the base or selected value, lacks an approved value.
has-identity-assurance-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP may have a Digital Identity Determination identity assurance level property.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP may lack a Digital Identity Determination identity-assurance-level property.
has-authenticator-assurance-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP may have a Digital Identity Determination authenticator assurance level property.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP may lack a Digital Identity Determination authenticator-assurance-level property.
has-federation-assurance-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP may have a Digital Identity Determination federation assurance level property.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP may lack a Digital Identity Determination federation-assurance-level property.
has-allowed-identity-assurance-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP should have an allowed Digital Identity Determination identity assurance level.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP may lack an allowed Digital Identity Determination identity-assurance-level property.
has-allowed-authenticator-assurance-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP should have an allowed Digital Identity Determination authenticator assurance level.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP may lack an allowed Digital Identity Determination authenticator-assurance-level property.
has-allowed-federation-assurance-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP should have an allowed Digital Identity Determination federation assurance level.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP may lack an allowed Digital Identity Determination federation-assurance-level property.
has-inventory-items
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate inventory items.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks inventory-item elements.
has-unique-asset-id
👍 Every asset identifier must be unique.
👎 This asset id <sch:value-of select="@asset-id"/> is not unique. An asset id must be unique within the scope of a FedRAMP SSP document.
has-allowed-asset-type
👍 An asset type should have an allowed value.
👎 <sch:value-of select="@name"/> prop may have an asset type other than FedRAMP ones - this one uses "<sch:value-of select="@value"/>".
has-allowed-virtual
👍 A virtual property must have an allowed value.
👎 <sch:value-of select="name()"/> must have an allowed value <sch:value-of select="string-join($virtuals, ' ∨ ')"/> (not " <sch:value-of select="@value"/>").
has-allowed-public
👍 A public property must have an allowed value.
👎 <sch:value-of select="name()"/> must have an allowed value <sch:value-of select="string-join($publics, ' ∨ ')"/> (not " <sch:value-of select="@value"/>").
has-allowed-allows-authenticated-scan
👍 An allows-authenticated-scan property has an allowed value.
👎 <sch:value-of select="name()"/> must have an allowed value <sch:value-of select="string-join($allows-authenticated-scans, ' ∨ ')"/> (not " <sch:value-of select="@value"/>").
has-allowed-is-scanned
👍 is-scanned property must have an allowed value.
👎 <sch:value-of select="name()"/> must have an allowed value <sch:value-of select="string-join($is-scanneds, ' ∨ ')"/> (not " <sch:value-of select="@value"/>").
has-allowed-scan-type
👍 A scan-type property must have an allowed value.
👎 <sch:value-of select="name()"/> must have an allowed value <sch:value-of select="string-join($scan-types, ' ∨ ')"/> (not " <sch:value-of select="@value"/>").
component-has-allowed-type
👍 A component must have an allowed type.
👎 <sch:value-of select="name()"/> must have an allowed component type <sch:value-of select="string-join($component-types, ' ∨ ')"/> (not " <sch:value-of select="@type"/>").
component-has-asset-type
👍 A component must have an asset type.
👎 <sch:value-of select="name()"/> lacks an asset-type property.
component-has-one-asset-type
👍 A component must have only one asset type.
👎 <sch:value-of select="name()"/> has more than one asset-type property.

👎 This inventory-item lacks a uuid attribute.

👎 This inventory-item lacks an asset-id property.

👍 An inventory item must have only one asset identifier.
👎 This inventory-item has more than one asset-id property.

👎 This inventory-item purpose is insufficiently described (length must be 20 characters or more).

inventory-item-network-address
👍 If any inventory-item has a prop with a name of 'ipv4-address' it must also have a prop with a name of 'ipv6-address'.
👎 <sch:value-of select="oscal:prop[@name = 'asset-id']/@value"/> has an IPv4 address but does not have an IPv6 address.
ipv4-has-content
👍 <xsl:value-of select="oscal:prop[@name = 'asset-id']/@value"/> must have an appropriate IPv4 value.
👎 The @value content of prop whose @name is 'ipv4-address' has incorrect content.
ipv4-has-non-placeholder
👍 <xsl:value-of select="oscal:prop[@name = 'asset-id']/@value"/> must have an appropriate IPv4 value.
👎 The @value content of prop whose @name is 'ipv4-address' has placeholder value of 0.0.0.0.
ipv6-has-content
👍 <xsl:value-of select="oscal:prop[@name = 'asset-id']/@value"/> must have an appropriate IPv6 value.
👎 The @value content of prop whose @name is 'ipv6-address' has incorrect content.
ipv6-has-non-placeholder
👍 <xsl:value-of select="oscal:prop[@name = 'asset-id']/@value"/> must have an appropriate IPv6 value.
👎 The @value content of prop whose @name is 'ipv6-address' has placeholder value of ::.

👍 Each FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram has a link rel attribute with the value "diagram".
👎 This FedRAMP SSP data-flow diagram lacks a link rel attribute with the value "diagram".
has-data-flow-diagram-link-href-target
👍 A FedRAMP SSP data flow diagram link references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP data-flow diagram link does not reference a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.
system-security-plan-has-import-profile
👍 A FedRAMP SSP declares the related FedRAMP OSCAL Profile using an import-profile element.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks an import-profile element.
import-profile-has-href-attribute
👍 The import-profile element has a reference.
👎 The import-profile element lacks an href attribute.
implemented-requirement-has-implementation-status
👍 Every implemented requirement has an implementation-status property.
👎 This implemented-requirement lacks an implementation-status.
implemented-requirement-has-planned-completion-date
👍 Planned control implementations have a planned completion date.
👎 This planned control implementations lacks a planned completion date.
implemented-requirement-has-control-origination
👍 Every implemented requirement has a control origin.
👎 This implemented-requirement lacks a control-origination property.
implemented-requirement-has-allowed-control-origination
👍 Every implemented requirement has an allowed control origination.
👎 This implemented-requirement lacks an allowed control-origination property.
implemented-requirement-has-leveraged-authorization
👍 Every implemented requirement with a control origination of "inherited" references a leveraged authorization.
👎 This implemented-requirement with a control-origination property of "inherited" does not reference a leveraged-authorization element in the same document.
partial-implemented-requirement-has-plan
👍 A partially implemented control must have a plan for complete implementation.
👎 This partially complete implemented-requirement is lacking an implementation-status of 'planned' and an accompanying date.
implemented-requirement-has-allowed-composite-implementation-status
👍 An implemented control's implementation status must be implemented, partial and planned, planned, alternative, or not applicable.
👎 This implemented-requirement has an invalid implementation-status composition (<sch:value-of select="string-join((oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'implementation-status']/@value), ', ')"/>).
implemented-requirement-has-required-response-points
👍 An implemented control must include required response point statements.
👎 This implemented requirement is missing required response point(s). Required response points are <sch:value-of select="$required-response-points"/>; only <sch:value-of select="$provided-response-points"/>) response point(s) are provided.
set-parameter-elements-match-baseline
👍 In the corresponding baseline-resolved-profile catalog, all param elements, that do not have child value elements, have an @id value that also occurs in the matching implemented-requirement set-parameter element @id in the SSP.
👎 For Control <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/> - Some values of the SSP set-parameter/@param-id attributes do not match the corresponding control/param/@id values in the baseline catalog. SSP set-parameter/@param-id values - <xsl:value-of select="oscal:set-parameter/@param-id"/> Catalog param/@id values- <xsl:value-of select="$selected-profile//oscal:control[@id eq current()/@control-id]/oscal:param[not(oscal:value)]/@id"/>.
set-parameter-elements-match-baseline1
👍 In the SSP, all implemented-requirement set-parameter element @id values also occur in the corresponding baseline-resolved-profile catalog param elements, that do not have child value elements, @id attributes.
👎 For Control <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/> - Some values of the control/param/@id in the baseline catalog do not match the corresponding SSP set-parameter/@param-id attribute values. Catalog param/@id values- <xsl:value-of select="$selected-profile//oscal:control[@id eq current()/@control-id]/oscal:param[not(oscal:value)]/@id"/> SSP set-parameter/@param-id values - <xsl:value-of select="oscal:set-parameter/@param-id"/>.
remote-multi-factor-authentication-described
👍 Implemented Requirement <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/> exists.
👎 The implemented requirement <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/> does not contain the strings 'CMVP validated' or 'NIAP Certification' or 'NSA approval'.
implemented-requirement-has-allowed-implementation-status
👍 An implemented control's implementation status has an allowed value.
👎 This implemented control's implementation status lacks an allowed value.
implemented-requirement-has-implementation-status-remarks
👍 Incomplete control implementations have an explanation.
👎 This incomplete control implementation lacks an explanation.
planned-completion-date-is-valid
👍 Planned completion date is valid.
👎 This planned completion date is not valid.
planned-completion-date-is-not-past
👍 Planned completion date is not past.
👎 This planned completion date references a past time.
has-inherited-description
👍 An inherited control implementation description must contain at least 32 words.
👎 This inherited control implementation description has less than 32 words.
uses-correct-param-value
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must use correct parameter value.
👎 The parameter <xsl:value-of select="current()/@param-id"/> does not match the corresponding baseline resolved profile catalog parameter constraint description for the control.
has-cloud-service-model
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define a cloud service model.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP must specify a cloud service model.
has-allowed-cloud-service-model
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define an allowed cloud service model.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed cloud service model.
has-leveraged-authorization-with-cloud-service-model
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define a leveraged authorization for any 'paas' or 'saas' cloud service model.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud service model of 'paas' or 'saas' must specify a leveraged authorization.
has-cloud-service-model-remarks
👍 A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud service model of "other" must supply remarks.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud service model of "other" must supply remarks.

👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define a cloud deployment model.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP must specify a cloud deployment model.
has-allowed-cloud-deployment-model

👎 A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed cloud deployment model.
has-cloud-deployment-model-remarks
👍 A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud deployment model of "hybrid-cloud" must supply remarks.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud deployment model of "hybrid-cloud" must supply remarks.
has-public-cloud-deployment-model
👍 When a FedRAMP SSP has public components or inventory items, a cloud deployment model of "public-cloud" must be employed.
👎 When a FedRAMP SSP has public components or inventory items, a cloud deployment model of "public-cloud" must be employed.
interconnection-has-allowed-interconnection-direction-value
👍 A system interconnection must have an allowed interconnection-direction.
👎 A system interconnection lacks an allowed interconnection-direction to explain data direction for information transmitted.
interconnection-has-allowed-interconnection-security-value
👍 A system interconnection must have an allowed interconnection-security value.
👎 A system interconnection lacks an allowed interconnection-security that explains what kind of methods are used to secure information transmitted while in transit.
interconnection-has-interconnection-security-remarks
👍 A system interconnection with an interconnection-security of "other" must have explanatory remarks.
👎 This system interconnection defines an alternate method for securing information in transit, where interconnection-security is defined as "other" and the required explanatory remarks are missing.

👎 This system interconnection lacks a remote system name.

👍 A system interconnection must provide a remote system description.
👎 This system interconnection lacks a remote system description.
interconnection-has-direction
👍 A system interconnection must identify the direction of data flows.
👎 This system interconnection lacks the direction of data flows.
interconnection-has-information
👍 A system interconnection must describe the information being transferred.
👎 This system interconnection does not describe the information being transferred.
interconnection-has-protocol
👍 A system interconnection must describe the protocols used for information transfer.
👎 A system interconnection does not describe the protocols used for information transfer.
interconnection-has-service-processor
👍 A system interconnection must describe the service processor.
👎 This system interconnection does not describe the service processor.
interconnection-has-local-and-remote-addresses
👍 A system interconnection must define local and remote network addresses.
👎 This system interconnection does not specify local and remote network addresses.
interconnection-has-interconnection-security
👍 A system interconnection must define how the connection is secured.
👎 This system interconnection does not specify how the connection is secured.
interconnection-has-circuit
👍 A system interconnection which uses a dedicated circuit switching network must specify the circuit number.
👎 This system interconnection does not specify the port or circuit used.
interconnection-has-isa-poc-local
👍 A system interconnection must specify a responsible local (CSP) point of contact.
👎 This system interconnection does not specify a responsible local (CSP) point of contact.
interconnection-has-isa-poc-remote
👍 A system interconnection must specify a responsible remote point of contact.
👎 This system interconnection does not specify a responsible remote point of contact.
interconnection-has-isa-authorizing-official-local
👍 A system interconnection must specify a local authorizing official.
👎 This system interconnection does not specify a local authorizing official.
interconnection-has-isa-authorizing-official-remote
👍 A system interconnection must specify a remote authorizing official.
👎 This system interconnection does not specify a remote authorizing official.
interconnection-has-responsible-persons
👍 Every responsible person for a system interconnect is defined.
👎 Not every responsible person for this system interconnect is defined.
interconnection-has-distinct-isa-local
👍 A system interconnection must define local responsible parties which are not remote responsible parties.
👎 This system interconnection has local responsible parties which are also remote responsible parties.
interconnection-has-distinct-isa-remote
👍 A system interconnection must define remote responsible parties which are not local responsible parties.
👎 This system interconnection has remote responsible parties which are also local responsible parties.
interconnection-cites-interconnection-agreement
👍 A system interconnection must cite an interconnection agreement.
👎 This system interconnection does not cite an interconnection agreement.
interconnection-cites-interconnection-agreement-href
👍 A system interconnection must cite an intra-document defined interconnection agreement.
👎 This system interconnection does not cite an intra-document defined interconnection agreement.
interconnection-cites-attached-interconnection-agreement
👍 A system interconnection must cite an intra-document attached interconnection agreement and that agreement must be present in the SSP.
👎 This system interconnection cites an absent interconnection agreement.
interconnection-protocol-has-name
👍 A system interconnection protocol must have a name.
👎 This system interconnection protocol lacks a name.
interconnection-protocol-has-port-range
👍 A system interconnection protocol should have one or more port range declarations.
👎 This system interconnection protocol lacks one or more port range declarations.
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-transport
👍 A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a transport protocol.
👎 This system interconnection protocol port range declaration does not state a transport protocol.
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-start
👍 A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a starting port number.
👎 A system interconnection protocol port range declaration does not state a starting port number.
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-end
👍 A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state an ending port number. The start and end port number can be the same if there is one port number.
👎 A system interconnection protocol port range declaration does not state an ending port number.
has-expected-network-protocols
👍 All expected network protocols are specified.
👎 One or more expected network protocols were not defined (within components). The expected network protocols are <sch:value-of select="string-join($expected-network-protocols, ', ')"/>.
has-DNS-authoritative-service
👍 A DNS authoritative service is defined.
👎 No DNS authoritative service is specified in the SSP.
has-DNS-zone
👍 The DNS authoritative service has one or more zones specified.
👎 A DNS authoritative service is specified but no zones are specified.
has-well-formed-DNS-zone
👍 Each zone name for the DNS authoritative service is well-formed.
👎 The DNS zone "<sch:value-of select="@value"/>" is not well-formed.
has-resolved-zone
👍 Each zone for the DNS authoritative service can be resolved.

Assertions

The following table lists Schematron assert and report elements with the Schematron ID, assertion (affirmative statement), diagnostic (negative statement used when the assertion was false), and related attributes. Each of these is subordinate to a context defined in a parent Schematron rule element.

List of assertions

There are 298 Schematron assertions as of this update

test: $use-debug-mode eq true()
role: information
affirmative XSpec test: no coverage
negative XSpec test: no coverage

no-security-sensitivity-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define its sensitivity level.
👎 No sensitivity level was found. Allowed values are: <sch:value-of select="$corrections"/>. As a result, no more validation processing can occur.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan
test: $sensitivity-level ne ''
role: fatal
affirmative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 2.1 ➔ when the security sensitivity level ➔ is defined ➔ it is valid.
negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 2.1 ➔ when the security sensitivity level ➔ is not defined at all ➔ it is invalid.
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section C Check 1.a
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.2
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2.2
invalid-security-sensitivity-level

context: /oscal:system-security-plan
test: empty($ok-values) or not(exists($corrections))
role: fatal
affirmative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 2.1 ➔ when the security sensitivity level ➔ is set to a value from the official FedRAMP list ➔ it is valid.
negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 2.1 ➔ when the security sensitivity level ➔ is not set to a value from the official FedRAMP list ➔ it is invalid.
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section C Check 1.a
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.2
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2.2

negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 13 ➔ when an extraneous control not required by the profile is implemented ➔ it is invalid.

DNSSEC-described
👍 Implemented Requirement <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/> exists.
👎 The implemented requirement does not contain the strings 'DNSSEC' or 'DNS Security Extensions'.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:control-implementation/oscal:implemented-requirement

role: warning

negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ A FedRAMP SSP has a control sc-20 or sc-21 and the specified control makes reference to either 'DNSSEC' or 'DNS Security Extensions'.' ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error.

extraneous-response-remarks
👍 Response statement does not have remarks not within a component.
👎 Response statement <sch:value-of select="../@statement-id"/> has remarks not within a component. That was previously allowed, but not recommended. It will soon be syntactically invalid and deprecated.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:control-implementation/oscal:implemented-requirement/oscal:statement
test: not(exists(oscal:remarks))
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 13 ➔ when control implementations are defined ➔ and implemented requirements do not have explanatory statement remarks defined directly in the statement ➔ this is valid.
negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 13 ➔ when control implementations are defined ➔ and implemented requirements have explanatory statement remarks defined directly in the statement ➔ this is invalid.
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section D Checks
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
invalid-component-match
👍 Response statement cites a component in the system implementation inventory.
👎 Response statement <sch:value-of select="../@statement-id"/> with component reference UUID ' <sch:value-of select="$component-ref"/>' is not in the system implementation inventory, and cannot be used to define a control.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:control-implementation/oscal:implemented-requirement/oscal:statement/oscal:by-component
test: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:system-implementation/oscal:component[@uuid eq $component-ref] => exists()
role: warning
affirmative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 13 ➔ when control implementations are defined ➔ and implemented requirements have a component reference ➔ and it references a component with a valid ID. ➔ it is valid.
negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 13 ➔ when control implementations are defined ➔ and implemented requirements have a component reference ➔ and it references a component with an ID not previously declared. ➔ and it references a component with an ID and no components are declared. ➔ it generates a warning. ➔ it generates a warning.
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section D Checks
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
missing-component-description
👍 Response statement has a component which has a required description.
👎 Response statement <sch:value-of select="../@statement-id"/> has a component, but that component is missing a required description node.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:control-implementation/oscal:implemented-requirement/oscal:statement/oscal:by-component
test: ./oscal:description => exists()
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 13 ➔ when control implementations are defined ➔ and implemented requirements have explanatory statement in a component reference ➔ and the component reference has a description ➔ it is valid.
negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 13 ➔ when control implementations are defined ➔ and implemented requirements have explanatory statement in a component reference ➔ and the component reference has no description ➔ it is valid.
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section D Checks
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
incomplete-response-description
👍 Response statement component description has adequate length.
👎 Response statement component description for <sch:value-of select="../../@statement-id"/> is too short with <sch:value-of select="$description-length"/> characters. It must be <sch:value-of select="$required-length"/> characters long.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:control-implementation/oscal:implemented-requirement/oscal:statement/oscal:by-component/oscal:description
test: $description-length ge $required-length
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 13 ➔ when control implementations are defined ➔ and implemented requirements have explanatory statement descriptions properly defined in a component reference ➔ and it is sufficiently long ➔ it is valid.
negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 13 ➔ when control implementations are defined ➔ and implemented requirements have explanatory statement descriptions properly defined in a component reference ➔ and it is not sufficiently long ➔ it is invalid.
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section D Checks
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
incomplete-response-remarks
👍 Response statement component remarks have adequate length.
👎 Response statement component remarks for <sch:value-of select="../../@statement-id"/> is too short with <sch:value-of select="$remarks-length"/> characters. It must be <sch:value-of select="$required-length"/> characters long.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:control-implementation/oscal:implemented-requirement/oscal:statement/oscal:by-component/oscal:remarks
test: $remarks-length ge $required-length
role: warning

negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 13 ➔ when control implementations are defined ➔ and implemented requirements have explanatory statement remarks properly defined in a component reference ➔ and it is not sufficiently long ➔ it is invalid.
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section D Checks

FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
incorrect-role-association
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with no extraneous roles.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP must define a responsible party with <sch:value-of select="count($extraneous-roles)"/><sch:value-of select=" if (count($extraneous-roles) = 1) then ' role' else ' roles'"/> not defined in the role: <sch:value-of select="$extraneous-roles/@role-id"/>.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:metadata
test: not(exists($extraneous-roles))
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 6 ➔ when responsible party ➔ references a valid role and valid party ➔ role positive case.
negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 6 ➔ when responsible party ➔ references an invalid role but valid party ➔ references an invalid role and invalid party ➔ role-id referenced is not defined case. ➔ role-id referenced is not defined case.

has-policy-link
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a policy document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.
👎 implemented-requirement <sch:value-of select="@control-id"/> lacks policy reference(s) via legacy or component approach.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement[matches(@control-id, '^[a-z]{2}-1$')]
test: (: legacy approach :) (descendant::oscal:by-component/oscal:link[@rel eq 'policy']) or (: component approach :) (some $c in //oscal:component[@uuid = current()/descendant::oscal:by-component/@component-uuid] satisfies $c/@type = 'policy' and $c/oscal:link[@rel eq 'policy'])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Attachments ➔ Required attachments: ➔ Policy and Procedure Attachments: ➔ for the policy facet of P&P controls, ➔ when the policy link to the resource declaring the policy document attachment is via a direct link and ➔ is present ➔ when the policy link to the resource declaring the policy document attachment is via a component and ➔ is present ➔ that is correct ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Attachments ➔ Required attachments: ➔ Policy and Procedure Attachments: ➔ for the policy facet of P&P controls, ➔ when the policy link to the resource declaring the policy document attachment is via a direct link and ➔ is absent ➔ when the policy link to the resource declaring the policy document attachment is via a component and ➔ is absent ➔ that is an error ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.1
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §6
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15 Attachment 1
has-policy-attachment-resource
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a policy document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.
👎 implemented-requirement <sch:value-of select="@control-id"/> lacks policy attachment resource(s) <sch:value-of select="string-join($policy-hrefs, ', ')"/>.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement[matches(@control-id, '^[a-z]{2}-1$')]
test: every $ref in $policy-hrefs satisfies exists(//oscal:resource[oscal:prop[@name eq 'type' and @value eq 'policy']][@uuid eq $ref])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Attachments ➔ Required attachments: ➔ Policy and Procedure Attachments: ➔ for the policy facet of P&P controls, ➔ when the policy attachment resource ➔ is present ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Attachments ➔ Required attachments: ➔ Policy and Procedure Attachments: ➔ for the policy facet of P&P controls, ➔ when the policy attachment resource ➔ is absent ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.1
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §6
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15 Attachment 1
has-procedure-link
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a procedure document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.
👎 implemented-requirement <sch:value-of select="@control-id"/> lacks procedure reference(s) via legacy or component approach.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement[matches(@control-id, '^[a-z]{2}-1$')]
test: (: legacy approach :) (descendant::oscal:by-component/oscal:link[@rel eq 'procedure']) or (: component approach :) (some $c in //oscal:component[@uuid = current()/descendant::oscal:by-component/@component-uuid] satisfies $c/@type = 'procedure' and $c/oscal:link[@rel eq 'procedure'])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Attachments ➔ Required attachments: ➔ Policy and Procedure Attachments: ➔ for the procedure facet of P&P controls, ➔ when the procedure link to the resource declaring the procedure document attachment is via a direct link and ➔ is present ➔ when the procedure link to the resource declaring the procedure document attachment is via a component and ➔ is present ➔ that is correct ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Attachments ➔ Required attachments: ➔ Policy and Procedure Attachments: ➔ for the procedure facet of P&P controls, ➔ when the procedure link to the resource declaring the procedure document attachment is via a direct link and ➔ is absent ➔ when the procedure link to the resource declaring the procedure document attachment is via a component and ➔ is absent ➔ that is an error ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.1
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §6
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15
has-procedure-attachment-resource
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a procedure document for each of the 17 NIST SP 800-54 Revision 4 control families.
👎 implemented-requirement <sch:value-of select="@control-id"/> lacks procedure attachment resource(s) <sch:value-of select="string-join($procedure-hrefs, ', ')"/>.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement[matches(@control-id, '^[a-z]{2}-1$')]
test: (: targets of links exist in the document :) every $ref in $procedure-hrefs satisfies exists(//oscal:resource[oscal:prop[@name eq 'type' and @value eq 'procedure']][@uuid eq $ref])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Attachments ➔ Required attachments: ➔ Policy and Procedure Attachments: ➔ for the procedure facet of P&P controls, ➔ when the procedure attachment resource ➔ is present ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Attachments ➔ Required attachments: ➔ Policy and Procedure Attachments: ➔ for the procedure facet of P&P controls, ➔ when the procedure attachment resource ➔ is absent ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.1
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §6
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15 Attachment 1
has-unique-policy-and-procedure
👍 Policy and procedure documents must have unique per-control-family associations.
👎 A policy or procedure reference was incorrectly re-used.
context: oscal:by-component/oscal:link[@rel = ('policy', 'procedure')]
test: not( (: the current @href is not in :) @href = (: all controls except the current :) (//oscal:implemented-requirement[matches(@control-id, '^[a-z]{2}-1$')] except $ir) (: all their @hrefs :)/descendant::oscal:by-component/oscal:link[@rel eq 'policy']/@href )
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Attachments ➔ Required attachments: ➔ Policy and Procedure Attachments: ➔ for all P&P controls, ➔ when no resource is re-used ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Attachments ➔ Required attachments: ➔ Policy and Procedure Attachments: ➔ for all P&P controls, ➔ when a resource is inappropriately re-used ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.1
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §6
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15 Attachment 1
has-privacy-poc-role
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a Privacy Point of Contact role.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Privacy Point of Contact role.
context: oscal:metadata
test: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:metadata/oscal:role[@id eq 'privacy-poc']
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ when the privacy-poc role ➔ is defined ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ when the privacy-poc role ➔ is missing ➔ that is an error

has-correct-yes-or-no-answer
👍 A Privacy Threshold Analysis (PTA)/Privacy Impact Analysis (PIA) qualifying question must have an allowed answer.
👎 This property has an incorrect value: should be "yes" or "no".
context: oscal:prop[@name eq 'privacy-sensitive'] | oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @class eq 'pta' and matches(@name, '^pta-\d$')]
test: current()/@value = ('yes', 'no')
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ when the privacy-sensitive designation value ➔ is yes or no ➔ when the PTA/PIA qualifying question ➔ #1 ➔ is properly answered ➔ #2 ➔ is properly answered ➔ #3 ➔ is properly answered ➔ #4 ➔ is properly answered ➔ that is correct ➔ that is correct ➔ that is correct ➔ that is correct ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ when the privacy-sensitive designation value ➔ is not yes or no ➔ when the PTA/PIA qualifying question ➔ #1 ➔ is not properly answered ➔ #2 ➔ is not properly answered ➔ #3 ➔ is not properly answered ➔ #4 ➔ is not properly answered ➔ that is an error ➔ that is an error ➔ that is an error ➔ that is an error ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.4

has-all-pta-questions
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have all four PTA questions.
👎 One or more of the four PTA questions is missing.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:system-characteristics/oscal:system-information
test: every $name in ('pta-1', 'pta-2', 'pta-3', 'pta-4') satisfies exists(oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @class eq 'pta' and @name eq $name])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have all PTA questions. ➔ When this is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have all PTA questions. ➔ When this is false ➔ that is an error

has-correct-pta-question-cardinality
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must have no duplicate PTA questions.
👎 One or more of the four PTA questions is a duplicate.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:system-characteristics/oscal:system-information
test: not(some $name in ('pta-1', 'pta-2', 'pta-3', 'pta-4') satisfies exists(oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @class eq 'pta' and @name eq $name][2]))
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have no duplicate PTA questions. ➔ When this is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP must have no duplicate PTA questions. ➔ When this is false ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.4

has-sorn
👍 A FedRAMP SSP may have a SORN ID.
👎 The SORN ID is missing.
context: /oscal:system-security-plan/oscal:system-characteristics/oscal:system-information
test: oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @class eq 'pta' and @name eq 'pta-4' and @value eq 'yes'] and oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @class eq 'pta' and @name eq 'sorn-id' (: and @value ne '':)]
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ when the PTA/PIA qualifying question #4 is answered affirmatively ➔ and the SORN ID is provided ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ when the PTA/PIA qualifying question #4 is answered affirmatively ➔ and the SORN ID is not provided ➔ that is an error

has-pia
👍 This FedRAMP SSP must incorporate a Privacy Impact Analysis.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a Privacy Impact Analysis.
context: oscal:back-matter
test: every $answer in //oscal:system-information/oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @class eq 'pta' and matches(@name, '^pta-\d$')] satisfies $answer eq 'no' or oscal:resource[oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'type' and @value eq 'pia']] (: a PIA is attached :)
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ when the Privacy Impact Assessment ➔ is declared ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Privacy Components ➔ when the Privacy Impact Assessment ➔ is missing ➔ that is an error

has-CMVP-validation
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must incorporate one or more FIPS 140 validated modules.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP does not declare one or more FIPS 140 validated modules.
context: oscal:system-implementation
test: oscal:component[@type eq 'validation']
role: error

negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 140 validation ➔ when a system-implementation ➔ lacks a CMVP validation component ➔ that is an error

has-credible-CMVP-validation-reference
👍 A validation reference must provide a NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) certificate number.
👎 This validation-reference property does not resemble a CMVP certificate number.
context: oscal:prop[@name eq 'validation-reference']
test: matches(@value, '^\d{3,4}$')
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 140 validation ➔ when a CMVP validation-reference ➔ is credible ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 140 validation ➔ when a CMVP validation-reference ➔ is not credible ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans Appendix A
has-consonant-CMVP-validation-reference
👍 A validation reference must be in accord with its sibling validation details.
👎 This validation-reference property does not match its sibling validation-details href.
context: oscal:prop[@name eq 'validation-reference']
test: @value = tokenize(following-sibling::oscal:link[@rel eq 'validation-details']/@href, '/')[last()]
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 140 validation ➔ when a CMVP validation-reference ➔ is consonant ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 140 validation ➔ when a CMVP validation-reference ➔ is not consonant ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans Appendix A
has-credible-CMVP-validation-details
👍 A validation details must refer to a NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) certificate detail page.
👎 This validation-details link href attribute does not resemble a CMVP certificate URL.
context: oscal:link[@rel eq 'validation-details']
test: matches(@href, '^https://csrc\.nist\.gov/projects/cryptographic-module-validation-program/[Cc]ertificate/\d{3,4}$')
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 140 validation ➔ when a CMVP validation-details ➔ is credible ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 140 validation ➔ when a CMVP validation-details ➔ is not credible ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans Appendix A
has-accessible-CMVP-validation-details
👍 The NIST Cryptographic Module Validation Program (CMVP) certificate detail page is available.
👎 This validation-details link references an inaccessible NIST CMVP certificate.
context: oscal:link[@rel eq 'validation-details']
test: not($use-remote-resources) or unparsed-text-available(@href)
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: no coverage
negative XSpec test: no coverage
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans Appendix A
has-consonant-CMVP-validation-details
👍 A validation details link must be in accord with its sibling validation reference.
👎 This validation-details link href attribute does not match its sibling validation-reference value.
context: oscal:link[@rel eq 'validation-details']
test: tokenize(@href, '/')[last()] = preceding-sibling::oscal:prop[@name eq 'validation-reference']/@value
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 140 validation ➔ when a CMVP validation-details ➔ is consonant ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 140 validation ➔ when a CMVP validation-details ➔ is not consonant ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans Appendix A
