has-allowed-security-sensitivity-level
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed security sensitivity level.
👎 Invalid security-sensitivity-level "<sch:value-of select="."/>". It must have one of the following <sch:value-of select="count($security-sensitivity-levels)"/> values: <sch:value-of select="string-join($security-sensitivity-levels, ' ∨ ')"/>.
context: oscal:security-sensitivity-level
test: current() = $security-sensitivity-levels
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 199 Categorization ➔ when a security-sensitivity-level ➔ has an allowed value ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 199 Categorization ➔ when a security-sensitivity-level ➔ lacks an allowed value ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.10
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.4
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2
security-sensitivity-level-matches-security-impact-level
👍 <xsl:value-of select="$securityLevelStr"/> -- A FedRAMP SSP security sensitivity level must match the highest level within the security impact levels.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP security sensitivity level does not match the security impact level.
context: oscal:security-sensitivity-level
test: . eq $securityImpactLevel
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 2.1 ➔ when the security sensitivity level ➔ matches the highest value in the security impact levels, security objectives ➔ it is correct.
negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 2.1 ➔ when the security sensitivity level ➔ does not match the highest value in the security impact levels, security objectives ➔ it is incorrect.
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section B Check 3.10
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.4
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2.2
has-security-objective-confidentiality
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify a confidentiality security objective.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP lacks a confidentiality security objective.
context: oscal:security-impact-level
test: oscal:security-objective-confidentiality
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 199 Categorization ➔ when a security-impact-level ➔ has a security-objective-confidentiality ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 199 Categorization ➔ when a security-impact-level ➔ lacks a security-objective-confidentiality ➔ that is an error

has-allowed-security-objective-value
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify an allowed security objective value.
👎 Invalid "<sch:value-of select="name()"/>" <sch:value-of select="."/>". It must have one of the following <sch:value-of select="count($security-objective-levels)"/> values: <sch:value-of select="string-join($security-objective-levels, ' ∨ ')"/>.
context: oscal:security-objective-confidentiality | oscal:security-objective-integrity | oscal:security-objective-availability
test: current() = $security-objective-levels
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 199 Categorization ➔ when a security-objective ➔ has an allowed security objective value ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP FIPS 199 Categorization ➔ when a security-objective ➔ lacks an allowed security objective value ➔ that is an error

FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §2.2
cia-impact-matches-security-objective
👍 An SSP security objective value must be the same as highest available value of the same information type impact element.
👎 The FedRAMP SSP security objective <xsl:value-of select="substring-after(substring-after(local-name(), '-'), '-')"/> does not match the <xsl:value-of select="substring-after(substring-after(local-name(), '-'), '-')"/> impact value.
context: oscal:security-objective-confidentiality | oscal:security-objective-integrity | oscal:security-objective-availability
test: $impactValue eq .
role: warning
affirmative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 2.1 ➔ when security objective values ➔ match the comparable information type impact values ➔ it is correct.
negative XSpec test: For an OSCAL FedRAMP SSP ➔ Section 2.1 ➔ when security objective values ➔ do not match the highest value in the security impact levels, security objectives ➔ it is incorrect.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.4

categorization-has-correct-system-attribute
👍 A FedRAMP SSP information type categorization must have a correct system attribute.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP information-type categorization lacks a correct system attribute. The correct value is "https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-60v2r1".

cia-impact-has-adjustment-justification
👍 When SP 800-60 base and selected impacts levels differ for a given information type, the SSP must include a justification for the difference.
👎 These SP 800-60 base and selected impact levels differ, but no justification for the difference is supplied.
context: oscal:confidentiality-impact | oscal:integrity-impact | oscal:availability-impact
test: if (oscal:base ne oscal:selected) then exists(oscal:adjustment-justification) else true()
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP SP 800-60v2r1 Information Types ➔ when a information-type confidentiality-, integrity-, or availability-impact ➔ has an adjustment-justification ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP SP 800-60v2r1 Information Types ➔ when a information-type confidentiality-, integrity-, or availability-impact ➔ lacks an adjustment-justification ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.3
cia-impact-has-approved-fips-categorization
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must indicate for its information system the appropriate categorization for the respective confidentiality, integrity, impact levels of its information types (per FIPS-199).
👎 This FedRAMP SSP information type's confidentiality, integrity, or availability impact level, either the base or selected value, lacks an approved value.
context: oscal:base | oscal:selected
test: . = $fips-199-levels
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP SP 800-60v2r1 Information Types ➔ when a information-type confidentiality-, integrity-, or availability-impact ➔ base element ➔ has an approved value ➔ selected element ➔ has an approved value ➔ that is correct ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP SP 800-60v2r1 Information Types ➔ when a information-type confidentiality-, integrity-, or availability-impact ➔ base element ➔ lacks an approved value ➔ selected element ➔ lacks an approved value ➔ that is an error ➔ that is an error

has-unique-asset-id
👍 Every asset identifier must be unique.
👎 This asset id <sch:value-of select="@asset-id"/> is not unique. An asset id must be unique within the scope of a FedRAMP SSP document.
context: oscal:prop[@name eq 'asset-id']
test: count(//oscal:prop[@name eq 'asset-id'][@value eq current()/@value]) = 1
role: error

context: oscal:prop[@name eq 'asset-type']

has-allowed-scan-type

context: oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'scan-type']
test: @value = $scan-types
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ scan-type property has an allowed value. ➔ affirmative ➔ correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ scan-type property has an allowed value. ➔ negative ➔ error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §6.5
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15 Attachment 13
component-has-allowed-type
👍 A component must have an allowed type.
👎 <sch:value-of select="name()"/> must have an allowed component type <sch:value-of select="string-join($component-types, ' ∨ ')"/> (not " <sch:value-of select="@type"/>").
context: oscal:component
test: @type = $component-types
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ component has an allowed type. ➔ affirmative ➔ correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ component has an allowed type. ➔ negative ➔ error

FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15 Attachment 13
component-has-asset-type
👍 A component must have an asset type.
👎 <sch:value-of select="name()"/> lacks an asset-type property.
context: oscal:component
test: (: not(@uuid = //oscal:inventory-item/oscal:implemented-component/@component-uuid) or :) oscal:prop[@name eq 'asset-type']
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ component has an asset type. ➔ affirmative ➔ correct

inventory-item-has-sufficient-purpose
👍 An inventory item must have a purpose property of adequate length (20 characters or more).
👎 This inventory-item purpose is insufficiently described (length must be 20 characters or more).
context: oscal:inventory-item
test: oscal:prop[@name eq 'purpose' and string-length(@value) ge 20]

has-prohibited-vendor-name
👍 The inventory item does not cite a banned vendor.
👎 This inventory-item contains a banned vendor. Please see https://www.fcc.gov/supplychain/coveredlist.
context: oscal:inventory-item
test: not(oscal:prop[@name eq 'vendor-name']/@value = $prohibit-vendor)
role: warning
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ has an acceptable vendor-name value ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ has a prohibited vendor-name value ➔ that is an error

FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §6.5
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §15 Attachment 13
inventory-item-network-address
👍 If any inventory-item has a prop with a name of 'ipv4-address' it must also have a prop with a name of 'ipv6-address'.
👎 <sch:value-of select="oscal:prop[@name = 'asset-id']/@value"/> has an IPv4 address but does not have an IPv6 address.
context: oscal:inventory-item
test: if (oscal:prop[@name eq 'ipv4-address']) then (oscal:prop[@name eq 'ipv6-address']) else (true())
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ both ipv4 and ipv6 defined in inventory-item ➔ affirmative ➔ correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ both ipv4 and ipv6 defined in inventory-item ➔ negative ➔ error
ipv4-has-content
👍 <xsl:value-of select="oscal:prop[@name = 'asset-id']/@value"/> must have an appropriate IPv4 value.
👎 The @value content of prop whose @name is 'ipv4-address' has incorrect content.
context: oscal:inventory-item
test: if (oscal:prop[@name eq 'ipv4-address']) then (oscal:prop[matches(@value, '(^[0-9][0-9]?[0-9]?\.[0-9][0-9]?[0-9]?\.[0-9][0-9]?[0-9]?\.[0-9][0-9]?[0-9]?$)')]) else (true())
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ ipv4 has appropriate content ➔ affirmative ➔ correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ ipv4 has appropriate content ➔ negative ➔ error
ipv4-has-non-placeholder
👍 <xsl:value-of select="oscal:prop[@name = 'asset-id']/@value"/> must have an appropriate IPv4 value.
👎 The @value content of prop whose @name is 'ipv4-address' has placeholder value of 0.0.0.0.
context: oscal:inventory-item
test: if (oscal:prop[@name eq 'ipv4-address']) then (oscal:prop[matches(@value, '0.0.0.0')]) else (false())
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ inventory-item has property name 'ipv4-address' that is a placeholder value ➔ affirmative ➔ correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ inventory-item has property name 'ipv4-address' that is a placeholder value ➔ negative ➔ error
ipv6-has-content
👍 <xsl:value-of select="oscal:prop[@name = 'asset-id']/@value"/> must have an appropriate IPv6 value.
👎 The @value content of prop whose @name is 'ipv6-address' has incorrect content.
context: oscal:inventory-item
test: if (oscal:prop[@name eq 'ipv6-address']) then (oscal:prop[matches(@value, $IPv6-regex)]) else (true())
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ ipv6 has appropriate content ➔ affirmative ➔ correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ ipv6 has appropriate content ➔ negative ➔ error
ipv6-has-non-placeholder
👍 <xsl:value-of select="oscal:prop[@name = 'asset-id']/@value"/> must have an appropriate IPv6 value.
👎 The @value content of prop whose @name is 'ipv6-address' has placeholder value of ::.
context: oscal:inventory-item
test: if (oscal:prop[@name eq 'ipv6-address']/@value eq '::') then (false()) else (true())
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ ipv6 has non-placeholder content ➔ affirmative ➔ correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Inventory ➔ when the inventory-item ➔ ipv6 has non-placeholder content ➔ negative ➔ error
has-users-internal
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must specify the number of current internal users.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP does not specify the number of current internal users.
context: oscal:system-implementation
test: oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name = 'users-internal' and @value castable as xs:integer and @value cast as xs:integer ge 0]
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Characteristics ➔ Affirmative test: ➔ A FedRAMP SSP must specify the number of current internal users. ➔ When it does ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP System Characteristics ➔ Negative test: ➔ A FedRAMP SSP must specify the number of current internal users. ➔ When it does not ➔ Non-negative number tests ➔ A FedRAMP SSP must specify a non-negative number of current internal users. ➔ When it does not ➔ that is an error ➔ that is an error

has-email-and-DMARC
👍 Email is either absent or sufficiently specified.
👎 Email is present but one or more of the following is missing from this SSP: DMARC, SPF, or DKIM.
context: oscal:system-implementation
test: if (//*[matches(lower-case(.), $emailString)]) then (if (../oscal:control-implementation/oscal:implemented-requirement[@control-id eq 'si-8']//*[matches(., 'DMARC')] and ../oscal:control-implementation/oscal:implemented-requirement[@control-id eq 'si-8']//*[matches(., 'SPF')] and ../oscal:control-implementation/oscal:implemented-requirement[@control-id eq 'si-8']//*[matches(., 'DKIM')]) then (false()) else (true())) else (true())
role: warning
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ A FedRAMP SSP references 'email', 'e-mail' or 'electronic mail and 'DMARC', 'SPF', and 'DKIM' are not referenced in control si-8.' ➔ When that is true ➔ that is an error.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ A FedRAMP SSP references 'email', 'e-mail' or 'electronic mail and has 'DMARC', 'SPF', and 'DKIM' referenced in control si-8.' ➔ When that is false ➔ that is correct.

data-center-US
👍 Each data center must have an address that is within the United States.
👎 The location address for a data center is not within the United States. The country element must contain the string 'US'.
context: oscal:location[oscal:prop[@value eq 'data-center']]
test: oscal:address/oscal:country eq 'US'
role: warning
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Roles ➔ affirmative ➔ The country in locations for data centers must be 'US' ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Roles ➔ negative ➔ The country in locations for data centers must be 'US' ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.23

👎 This implemented-requirement lacks a responsible-role definition.

test: oscal:responsible-role

has-network-architecture-diagram-link-rel
👍 Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a link rel attribute.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP network-architecture diagram lacks a link rel attribute.
context: oscal:network-architecture/oscal:diagram/oscal:link
test: @rel
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Diagrams ➔ affirmative unit tests ➔ Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network-architecture diagram has a link rel attribute. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Diagrams ➔ negative unit tests ➔ Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network-architecture diagram has a link rel attribute. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.22 Network Architecture Diagram
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §9.4
has-network-architecture-diagram-link-rel-allowed-value
👍 Each FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram has a link rel attribute with the value "diagram".
👎 This FedRAMP SSP network-architecture diagram lacks a link rel attribute with the value "diagram".
context: oscal:network-architecture/oscal:diagram/oscal:link
test: @rel eq 'diagram'
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Diagrams ➔ affirmative unit tests ➔ Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network-architecture diagram has a link rel attribute with the value "diagram". ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Diagrams ➔ negative unit tests ➔ Each FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network-architecture diagram has a link rel attribute with the value "diagram". ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.22 Network Architecture Diagram
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §9.4
has-network-architecture-diagram-link-href-target
👍 A FedRAMP SSP network architecture diagram link references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.
👎 This FedRAMP SSP network-architecture diagram link does not reference a back-matter resource representing the diagram document.
context: oscal:network-architecture/oscal:diagram/oscal:link
test: exists(//oscal:resource[@uuid eq substring-after(current()/@href, '#')])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Diagrams ➔ affirmative unit tests ➔ A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network-architecture diagram link references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Diagrams ➔ negative unit tests ➔ A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP network-architecture diagram link references a back-matter resource representing the diagram document. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.22 Network Architecture Diagram

test: oscal:data-flow
role: error

negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Diagrams ➔ negative unit tests ➔ A FedRAMP OSCAL SSP includes an data-flow in its system-characteristics. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error.

implemented-requirement-has-implementation-status

👎 This implemented-requirement lacks an implementation-status.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement
test: exists(oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'implementation-status'])
role: error

implemented-requirement-has-planned-completion-date
👍 Planned control implementations have a planned completion date.
👎 This planned control implementations lacks a planned completion date.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement
test: if (oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'implementation-status' and @value eq 'planned']) then exists(current()/oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'planned-completion-date']) else true()
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Planned control implementations have a planned completion date. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Planned control implementations have a planned completion date. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error

implemented-requirement-has-leveraged-authorization
👍 Every implemented requirement with a control origination of "inherited" references a leveraged authorization.
👎 This implemented-requirement with a control-origination property of "inherited" does not reference a leveraged-authorization element in the same document.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement
test: if (oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'control-origination' and @value eq 'inherited']) then (: there must be a leveraged-authorization-uuid property :) exists(oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'leveraged-authorization-uuid']) and (: the referenced leveraged-authorization must exist :) exists(//oscal:leveraged-authorization[@uuid = current()/oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'leveraged-authorization-uuid']/@value]) else true()
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Every implemented-requirement with a control-origination property of "inherited" references a leveraged-authorization. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Every implemented-requirement with a control-origination property of "inherited" references a leveraged-authorization. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5.3.1.1
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
partial-implemented-requirement-has-plan
👍 A partially implemented control must have a plan for complete implementation.
👎 This partially complete implemented-requirement is lacking an implementation-status of 'planned' and an accompanying date.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement
test: if (oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'implementation-status' and @value eq 'partial']) then exists(oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'implementation-status' and @value eq 'planned']) else true()
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ A partially implemented control must have a plan for complete implementation. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ A partially implemented control must have a plan for complete implementation. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5.3
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
implemented-requirement-has-allowed-composite-implementation-status
👍 An implemented control's implementation status must be implemented, partial and planned, planned, alternative, or not applicable.
👎 This implemented-requirement has an invalid implementation-status composition (<sch:value-of select="string-join((oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'implementation-status']/@value), ', ')"/>).
context: oscal:implemented-requirement
test: every $c in string-join(distinct-values((oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'implementation-status']/@value)), '-') satisfies $c = ('implemented', 'planned', 'alternative', 'not-applicable', 'partial-planned', 'planned-partial')
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ An implemented control must have a prop with only the allowed values. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ An implemented control must have a prop with only the allowed values. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5.3
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
implemented-requirement-has-required-response-points
👍 An implemented control must include required response point statements.
👎 This implemented requirement is missing required response point(s). Required response points are <sch:value-of select="$required-response-points"/>; only <sch:value-of select="$provided-response-points"/>) response point(s) are provided.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement
test: every $rrp in $required-response-points satisfies $rrp = $provided-response-points
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ An implemented control must include required response point statements. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ An implemented control must include required response point statements. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP checklist-reference: Section C Check 2
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
set-parameter-elements-match-baseline
👍 In the corresponding baseline-resolved-profile catalog, all param elements, that do not have child value elements, have an @id value that also occurs in the matching implemented-requirement set-parameter element @id in the SSP.
👎 For Control <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/> - Some values of the SSP set-parameter/@param-id attributes do not match the corresponding control/param/@id values in the baseline catalog. SSP set-parameter/@param-id values - <xsl:value-of select="oscal:set-parameter/@param-id"/> Catalog param/@id values- <xsl:value-of select="$selected-profile//oscal:control[@id eq current()/@control-id]/oscal:param[not(oscal:value)]/@id"/>.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement
test: every $i in $selected-profile//oscal:control[@id eq current()/@control-id]/oscal:param[not(oscal:value)]/@id satisfies exists(oscal:set-parameter[@param-id eq $i])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ In the corresponding baseline-resolved-profile catalog, all param elements, that do not have child value elements, have an @id value that also occurs in the matching implemented-requirement set-parameter element @id in the SSP. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ In the corresponding baseline-resolved-profile catalog, all param elements, that do not have child value elements, have an @id value that also occurs in the matching implemented-requirement set-parameter element @id in the SSP. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5.2
set-parameter-elements-match-baseline1
👍 In the SSP, all implemented-requirement set-parameter element @id values also occur in the corresponding baseline-resolved-profile catalog param elements, that do not have child value elements, @id attributes.
👎 For Control <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/> - Some values of the control/param/@id in the baseline catalog do not match the corresponding SSP set-parameter/@param-id attribute values. Catalog param/@id values- <xsl:value-of select="$selected-profile//oscal:control[@id eq current()/@control-id]/oscal:param[not(oscal:value)]/@id"/> SSP set-parameter/@param-id values - <xsl:value-of select="oscal:set-parameter/@param-id"/>.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement
test: every $i in current()//oscal:set-parameter/@param-id satisfies exists($selected-profile//oscal:control[@id eq current()/@control-id]/oscal:param[@id eq $i])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ In the SSP, all implemented-requirement set-parameter element @id values also occur in the corresponding baseline-resolved-profile catalog control param elements, that do not have child value elements, @id attributes. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ In the SSP, all implemented-requirement set-parameter element @id values also occur in the corresponding baseline-resolved-profile catalog control param elements, that do not have child value elements, @id attributes. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5.2
remote-multi-factor-authentication-described
👍 Implemented Requirement <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/> exists.
👎 The implemented requirement <xsl:value-of select="@control-id"/> does not contain the strings 'CMVP validated' or 'NIAP Certification' or 'NSA approval'.
context: oscal:implemented-requirement
test: if (matches(@control-id, 'ia-2.11')) then (if (self::oscal:implemented-requirement//*[matches(., 'CMVP validated|NIAP Certification|NSA approval')]) then (true()) else (false())) else (true())
role: warning
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ A FedRAMP SSP has a control ➔ ia-2(11) ➔ and the specified control makes reference to either 'CMVP validated' or 'NIAP Certification' or 'NSA approval'. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ A FedRAMP SSP has a control ➔ ia-2(11) ➔ and the specified control makes reference to either 'CMVP validated' or 'NIAP Certification' or 'NSA approval'. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is incorrect.
implemented-requirement-has-allowed-implementation-status
👍 An implemented control's implementation status has an allowed value.
👎 This implemented control's implementation status lacks an allowed value.
context: oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'implementation-status']
test: @value = $control-implementation-statuses
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ An implemented control's implementation status must be implemented, partial and planned, planned, alternative, or not applicable. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ An implemented control's implementation status must be implemented, partial and planned, planned, alternative, or not applicable. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error

FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
implemented-requirement-has-implementation-status-remarks
👍 Incomplete control implementations have an explanation.
👎 This incomplete control implementation lacks an explanation.
context: oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'implementation-status']
test: if (@value ne 'implemented') then oscal:remarks else true()
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Incomplete control implementations have an explanation. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Incomplete control implementations have an explanation. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error

planned-completion-date-is-valid
👍 Planned completion date is valid.
👎 This planned completion date is not valid.
context: oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'planned-completion-date']
test: @value castable as xs:date
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Planned completion date is valid. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Planned completion date is valid. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5.3
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §13
planned-completion-date-is-not-past
👍 Planned completion date is not past.
👎 This planned completion date references a past time.
context: oscal:prop[@ns eq 'https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal' and @name eq 'planned-completion-date']
test: not(@value castable as xs:date) or (@value castable as xs:date and xs:date(@value) gt current-date())
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Planned completion date is not past. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Planned completion date is not past. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5.3
has-inherited-description
👍 An inherited control implementation description must contain at least 32 words.
👎 This inherited control implementation description has less than 32 words.
context: oscal:inherited/oscal:description
test: count(tokenize(normalize-space(.), '\s+')) ge 32
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Inherited description is sufficient. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ Inherited description is sufficient. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §5.4.9
uses-correct-param-value
👍 A FedRAMP SSP must use correct parameter value.
👎 The parameter <xsl:value-of select="current()/@param-id"/> does not match the corresponding baseline resolved profile catalog parameter constraint description for the control.
context: oscal:set-parameter
test: if ($selected-profile//oscal:param[@id eq current()/@param-id]/oscal:constraint) then ($selected-profile//oscal:param[@id eq current()/@param-id][oscal:constraint/oscal:description/oscal:p eq current()/oscal:value]) else (true())
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ A FedRAMP SSP ➔ when comparing statement, by-component, set-parameter values against baseline-resolved-profile_catalog param ➔ matches value of corresponding set-parameter to param constraint ➔ when comparing implemented-requirement, set-parameter values against baseline-resolved-profile_catalog param ➔ matches value of corresponding set-parameter value to param constraint description ➔ when comparing control-implementation, set-parameter values against baseline-resolved-profile_catalog param ➔ matches value of corresponding set-parameter value to param constraint description ➔ that is correct ➔ that is correct ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Control Implementation ➔ A FedRAMP SSP ➔ when comparing statement, by-component, set-parameter values against baseline-resolved-profile_catalog param ➔ does not match value of corresponding set-parameter to param constraint ➔ when comparing implemented-requirement, set-parameter values against baseline-resolved-profile_catalog param ➔ does not match value of corresponding set-parameter to param constraint description ➔ when comparing control-implementation, set-parameter values against baseline-resolved-profile_catalog param ➔ does not match value of corresponding set-parameter to param constraint description ➔ that is an error ➔ that is an error ➔ that is an error

👎 A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud service model of 'paas' or 'saas' must specify a leveraged authorization.

role: warning

has-cloud-service-model-remarks
👍 A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud service model of "other" must supply remarks.
👎 A FedRAMP SSP with a cloud service model of "other" must supply remarks.
context: oscal:system-characteristics

has-public-cloud-deployment-model
👍 When a FedRAMP SSP has public components or inventory items, a cloud deployment model of "public-cloud" must be employed.
👎 When a FedRAMP SSP has public components or inventory items, a cloud deployment model of "public-cloud" must be employed.
context: oscal:system-characteristics
test: (: either there is no component or inventory-item tagged as 'public' :) not( exists(//oscal:component[oscal:prop[@name eq 'public' and @value eq 'yes']]) or exists(//oscal:inventory-item[oscal:prop[@name eq 'public' and @value eq 'yes']]) ) or (: a 'public-cloud' deployment model is employed :) exists(oscal:prop[@name eq 'cloud-deployment-model' and @value eq 'public-cloud'])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Cloud Service and Deployment Models ➔ When a FedRAMP SSP has public components or inventory items, a cloud deployment model of "public-cloud" must be employed. ➔ When that is not pertinent ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct ➔ that is correct
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Cloud Service and Deployment Models ➔ When a FedRAMP SSP has public components or inventory items, a cloud deployment model of "public-cloud" must be employed. ➔ When that is false ➔ that is an error
interconnection-has-allowed-interconnection-direction-value

👎 A system interconnection lacks an allowed interconnection-direction to explain data direction for information transmitted.
context: oscal:component[@type = 'interconnection']/oscal:prop[@name eq 'interconnection-direction']
test: @value = $interconnection-direction-values
role: error

negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Negative tests ➔ A system interconnection must have an allowed interconnection-direction. ➔ when it is not ➔ that is an error.

interconnection-has-responsible-persons
👍 Every responsible person for a system interconnect is defined.
👎 Not every responsible person for this system interconnect is defined.
context: oscal:component[@type eq 'interconnection']
test: exists(oscal:responsible-role/oscal:party-uuid) and (every $rp in descendant::oscal:party-uuid satisfies exists(//oscal:party[@uuid eq $rp and @type eq 'person']))

interconnection-has-distinct-isa-local
👍 A system interconnection must define local responsible parties which are not remote responsible parties.
👎 This system interconnection has local responsible parties which are also remote responsible parties.
context: oscal:component[@type eq 'interconnection']
test: every $p in oscal:responsible-role[matches(@role-id, 'local$')]/oscal:party-uuid satisfies not($p = oscal:responsible-role[matches(@role-id, 'remote$')]/oscal:party-uuid)
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Positive tests ➔ A system interconnection must specify local responsible parties which are not remote responsible parties. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Negative tests ➔ A system interconnection must specify local responsible parties which are not remote responsible parties. ➔ when it is not ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
interconnection-has-distinct-isa-remote
👍 A system interconnection must define remote responsible parties which are not local responsible parties.
👎 This system interconnection has remote responsible parties which are also local responsible parties.
context: oscal:component[@type eq 'interconnection']
test: every $p in oscal:responsible-role[matches(@role-id, 'remote$')]/oscal:party-uuid satisfies not($p = oscal:responsible-role[matches(@role-id, 'local$')]/oscal:party-uuid)
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Positive tests ➔ A system interconnection must specify remote responsible parties which are not local responsible parties. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Negative tests ➔ A system interconnection must specify remote responsible parties which are not local responsible parties. ➔ when it is not ➔ that is an error.

interconnection-cites-attached-interconnection-agreement
👍 A system interconnection must cite an intra-document attached interconnection agreement and that agreement must be present in the SSP.
👎 This system interconnection cites an absent interconnection agreement.
context: oscal:component[@type eq 'interconnection']
test: every $href in oscal:link[@rel eq 'agreement']/@href satisfies exists(//oscal:resource[@uuid eq substring-after($href, '#')])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Positive tests ➔ A system interconnection must cite an intra-document attached interconnection agreement and that agreement must be present in the SSP. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Negative tests ➔ A system interconnection must cite an intra-document attached interconnection agreement and that agreement must be present in the SSP. ➔ when it is not ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
interconnection-protocol-has-name
👍 A system interconnection protocol must have a name.
👎 This system interconnection protocol lacks a name.
context: oscal:component[@type eq 'interconnection']/oscal:protocol
test: @name
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Positive tests ➔ A system interconnection protocol must have a name. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Negative tests ➔ A system interconnection protocol must have a name. ➔ when it is not ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
interconnection-protocol-has-port-range
👍 A system interconnection protocol should have one or more port range declarations.
👎 This system interconnection protocol lacks one or more port range declarations.
context: oscal:component[@type eq 'interconnection']/oscal:protocol
test: oscal:port-range
role: warning
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Positive tests ➔ A system interconnection protocol should have one or more port range declarations. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Negative tests ➔ A system interconnection protocol should have one or more port range declarations. ➔ when it is not ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-transport
👍 A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a transport protocol.
👎 This system interconnection protocol port range declaration does not state a transport protocol.
context: oscal:component[@type eq 'interconnection']/oscal:protocol/oscal:port-range
test: @transport
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Positive tests ➔ A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a transport protocol. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Negative tests ➔ A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a transport protocol. ➔ when it is not ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-start
👍 A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a starting port number.
👎 A system interconnection protocol port range declaration does not state a starting port number.
context: oscal:component[@type eq 'interconnection']/oscal:protocol/oscal:port-range
test: @start
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Positive tests ➔ A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a starting port number. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Negative tests ➔ A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state a starting port number. ➔ when it is not ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
interconnection-protocol-port-range-has-end
👍 A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state an ending port number. The start and end port number can be the same if there is one port number.
👎 A system interconnection protocol port range declaration does not state an ending port number.
context: oscal:component[@type eq 'interconnection']/oscal:protocol/oscal:port-range
test: @end
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Positive tests ➔ A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state an ending port number. ➔ When that is true ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: FedRAMP OSCAL SSP Interconnections ➔ Negative tests ➔ A system interconnection protocol port range declaration must state an ending port number. ➔ when it is not ➔ that is an error.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.20
FedRAMP template-reference: System Security Plan Template §11
has-expected-network-protocols
👍 All expected network protocols are specified.
👎 One or more expected network protocols were not defined (within components). The expected network protocols are <sch:value-of select="string-join($expected-network-protocols, ', ')"/>.
context: oscal:system-implementation
test: every $p in $expected-network-protocols satisfies exists(//oscal:protocol[@name eq $p])
role: information
affirmative XSpec test: SSP Network Protocols ➔ When expected network protocols are present ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: SSP Network Protocols ➔ When expected network protocols are not present ➔ that is an anomaly.
FedRAMP guide-reference: Guide to OSCAL-based FedRAMP System Security Plans §4.25
has-DNS-authoritative-service
👍 A DNS authoritative service is defined.
👎 No DNS authoritative service is specified in the SSP.
context: oscal:system-implementation
test: exists(oscal:component[@type eq 'DNS-authoritative-service'])
role: information
affirmative XSpec test: Authoritative DNS Service positive tests ➔ When an authoritative DNS service is declared ➔ that is of interest.
negative XSpec test: Authoritative DNS Service negative tests ➔ When no authoritative DNS service is declared ➔ that is of interest.
has-DNS-zone
👍 The DNS authoritative service has one or more zones specified.
👎 A DNS authoritative service is specified but no zones are specified.
context: oscal:component[@type eq 'DNS-authoritative-service']
test: exists(oscal:prop[@name eq 'DNS-zone' and exists(@value)])
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: Authoritative DNS Service positive tests ➔ When an authoritative DNS service zone is declared ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: Authoritative DNS Service negative tests ➔ When no authoritative DNS service zone is declared ➔ that is an error.
has-well-formed-DNS-zone
👍 Each zone name for the DNS authoritative service is well-formed.
👎 The DNS zone "<sch:value-of select="@value"/>" is not well-formed.
context: oscal:component[$use-remote-resources][@type eq 'DNS-authoritative-service' and oscal:status/@state eq 'operational']/oscal:prop[@name eq 'DNS-zone']
test: $well-formed
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: Authoritative DNS Service positive tests ➔ When an authoritative DNS service zone is well-formed ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: Authoritative DNS Service negative tests ➔ When an authoritative DNS service zone is not well-formed ➔ that is an error.
has-resolved-zone
👍 Each zone for the DNS authoritative service can be resolved.
👎 The DNS query returned <sch:value-of select="$DoH_response"/>.
👎 The DNS zone "<sch:value-of select="@value"/>" did not resolve.
context: oscal:component[$use-remote-resources][@type eq 'DNS-authoritative-service' and oscal:status/@state eq 'operational']/oscal:prop[@name eq 'DNS-zone']
test: $has-resolved-zone
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: Authoritative DNS Service positive tests ➔ When an authoritative DNS service zone is resolvable ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: Authoritative DNS Service negative tests ➔ When an authoritative DNS service zone is not resolvable ➔ that is an error.
zone-has-DNSSEC
👍 Each zone for the DNS authoritative service has DNSSEC.
👎 The DNS query returned <sch:value-of select="$DoH_response"/>.
👎 The DNS zone "<sch:value-of select="@value"/>" lacks DNSSEC.
context: oscal:component[$use-remote-resources][@type eq 'DNS-authoritative-service' and oscal:status/@state eq 'operational']/oscal:prop[@name eq 'DNS-zone']
test: $has-resolved-zone and $response?AD eq true()
role: error
affirmative XSpec test: Authoritative DNS Service positive tests ➔ When an authoritative DNS service zone has DNSSEC ➔ that is correct.
negative XSpec test: Authoritative DNS Service negative tests ➔ When an authoritative DNS service zone lacks DNSSEC ➔ that is an error.
info-system-name
👍 <sch:value-of select="oscal:system-characteristics/oscal:system-name"/>
context: oscal:system-security-plan
test: true()
role: information
affirmative XSpec test: no coverage
negative XSpec test: no coverage
info-ssp-title
👍 <sch:value-of select="oscal:metadata/oscal:title"/>
context: oscal:system-security-plan
test: true()
role: information
affirmative XSpec test: no coverage
negative XSpec test: no coverage

FedRAMP Values

The fedramp_values.xml document contains value enumerations for various FedRAMP OSCAL document elements.

fedramp_values.xml constraints
NameValuesContext(s) - Light blue highlights use of name in context. Yellow highlights absence of name in context.
address-type
home
work
party/address/@type
Address Type: The type of address for the party
Remarks: FedRAMP requires work addresses.
allows-authenticated-scan
yes
no
inventory-item/prop[@name='allows-authenticated-scan']/@value
component/prop[@name='allows-authenticated-scan']/@value
Allows Authenticated Scan: Indicates if the asset is capable of having an authenticated scan.
Remarks: if the value is "no", the prop remarks must contain the reason why.
asset-type
operating-system
database
web-server
dns-server
email-server
directory-server
pbx
firewall
router
switch
storage-array
or any other value
component/prop[@name='asset-type']
inventory-item/prop[@name='asset-type']
Asset Type: Identifies the type of asset.

regulation
standard
guidance

procedure

Attachment Type: Identifies the type of attachment.

Remarks: If "yes" a SORN ID must be provided.

FedRAMP Extensions

The FedRAMP_extensions.xml document contains OSCAL schema extensions for FedRAMP OSCAL documents.

FedRAMP_extensions.xml constraints
NameValuesContext(s) - Light blue highlights use of name in context. Yellow highlights absence of name in context.
attachment-type
law
regulation
standard
guidance
policy
procedure
guide
rules-of-behavior
plan
system-security-plan
artifact
evidence
screen-shot
image
tool-report
raw-tool-output
interview-notes
questionnaire
report
fedramp-citations
fedramp-acronyms
fedramp-logo
separation-of-duties-matrix
logo
personal-identifiable-information
agreement
isa-agreement
incident-response-plan
information-security-policies-and-procedures
user-guide
privacy-impact-analysis
information-system-contingency-plan
configuration-management-plan
/*/o:back-matter/o:resource/o:prop[@name='type']
Attachment/Resource Types: FedRAMP additional attachment/resource types.
Remarks: These are in addition to the NIST-defined allowed values for resource types.
control-implementation-status-constraints
implemented
partial
planned
alternative
not-applicable
/o:system-security-plan/o:control-implmentation/o:implemented-requirement/o:prop[@name='implementation-status'][@ns='https://fedramp.gov/ns/oscal']/@value ☚ Note the @ns
Control Implementation Status Constraints: Defines the data type and allowed values for the Control Implementation Status
Remarks: When an extension is an prop, the data type and allowed values must be defined in a separate constraint.
control-origination-constraints
sp-corporate
sp-system
customer-configured
customer-provided
inherited

Control Origination: The point(s) from which the control satisfaction originates.

Assessment Role Identifiers: FedRAMP additional roles identifiers.
Remarks: These are in addition to the NIST-defined allowed values for role identifiers, and apply to OSCAL-based FedRAMP SAP and SAR content.
fedramp-general-role-identifiers
fedramp-pmo

observation-types

/o:plan-of-action-and-milestones/o:observation/o:type
/o:assessment-results/o:result/o:observation/o:type
Observation Types: In addition to the NIST observation types, FedRAMP requires observaton types to support risk deviations and vendor dependencies.
operational-status
operational
under-development
under-major-modification
disposition
other
o:status/@state
Operational Status (system): The operational status of the system
Remarks: FedRAMP limits the allowed values from a larger NIST-defined list to only those defined here.
planned-completion-date
/o:system-security-plan/o:control-implementation/o:implemented-requirement[o:prop[@name='implementation-status'][@value='planned']]
Planned Implementation Date Exists: If the control implementation status is "Planned" a "Planned Implementation Date" must be provided.
Remarks: In the SSP, if implemented-requirement includes prop[@name='implementation-status'] with value='planned', a planned-completion-date extension must be provided.
poam-risk-impacted-control
/o:plan-of-action-and-milestones/o:risk/o:prop
Impacted Control: At least one impacted control field is required in the POA&M.
sar-risk-impacted-control
/o:assessment-results/o:result/o:risk/o:prop
Impacted Control: The impacted control field is optional in the SAR, but helpful in anticipation of copying open risks to the POA&M.
security-level
fips-199-low
fips-199-moderate
fips-199-high
security-sensitivity-level
security-impact-level
(security-objective-confidentiality|security-objective-integrity|security-objective-availability)
system-information/information-type/(confidentiality-impact|integrity-impact|availability-impact)/(base|selected)
Security Impact Level: The security objective level as defined by NIST SP 800-60.
system-identifier-type
https://fedramp.gov
https://ietf.org/rfc/rfc4122
/o:system-security-plan/o:system-characteristics/o:system-id/@identifier-type
System Identifier Type: Enables an identifier to be formally recognized as being assigned by FedRAMP.
